jlyrics.features.LyricsFeatureExtractor

  • Packages that use LyricsFeatureExtractor 
    Package Description
    jlyrics  
    jlyrics.features  

    • Uses of LyricsFeatureExtractor in jlyrics

      Methods in jlyrics that return LyricsFeatureExtractor 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static LyricsFeatureExtractor[] LyricsFeatureProcessor.findOrderedFeatureExtractors(LyricsFeatureExtractor[] unordered_feature_extractors)
      Returns an array containing the same feature extractors as those provided, but reordered such that all features that require other features to be extracted will be extracted after those features.
      static LyricsFeatureExtractor[] LyricsFeatureProcessor.populateFeatureExtractorsToApply()
      Return the set of features to extract from lyrics data.
      Methods in jlyrics with parameters of type LyricsFeatureExtractor 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double[][][] LyricsFeatureProcessor.extractFeatures(SongLyrics[] song_lyrics, LyricsFeatureExtractor[] features_to_extract)
      Extract all of the specified features from all of the specified songs.
      static int[][] LyricsFeatureProcessor.findFeatureExtractorDependencies(LyricsFeatureExtractor[] feature_extractors)
      Goes through the given array of feature extractors and determines which features are dependent on which other features in terms of the indices of this given feature_extractors array.
      static LyricsFeatureExtractor[] LyricsFeatureProcessor.findOrderedFeatureExtractors(LyricsFeatureExtractor[] unordered_feature_extractors)
      Returns an array containing the same feature extractors as those provided, but reordered such that all features that require other features to be extracted will be extracted after those features.
      static ace.datatypes.FeatureDefinition[] LyricsFeatureProcessor.prepareFeatureDescriptions(LyricsFeatureExtractor[] features)
      Return ACE FeatureDefinition objects for each of the features to be extracted.
      static ace.datatypes.DataSet[] LyricsFeatureProcessor.prepareFeatureValues(SongLyrics[] song_lyrics, LyricsFeatureExtractor[] features_extracted, double[][][] feature_values)
      Return ACE DataSet objects for all of the extracted features.

      Subclasses of LyricsFeatureExtractor in jlyrics.features 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  AutomatedReadabilityIndex
      A feature extractor that extracts the Automated Readability Index.
      class  ContainsWords
      A feature extractor that extracts a binary feature indicating whether or not there is at least one word consisting of non whitespace chararacters in a text.
      class  LettersPerWordAverage
      A feature extractor that extracts the average number of characters per word.
      class  LettersPerWordVariance
      A feature extractor that extracts the variance of the number of characters per word.
      class  LinesPerSegmentAverage
      A feature extractor that extracts the average number of lines per segment (e.g.
      class  LinesPerSegmentVariance
      A feature extractor that extracts the variance of the number of lines per segment (e.g.
      class  NumberOfLines
      A feature extractor that extracts the total number of lines in a text.
      class  NumberOfSegments
      A feature extractor that extracts the total number of segments (e.g.
      class  NumberOfUniqueWords
      A feature extractor that extracts the total number of unique words in a text.
      class  NumberOfWords
      A feature extractor that extracts the total number of words in a text.
      class  WordProfileMatch
      A feature extractor that calculates the percentage of words in the given text that are found in an externally provided list of words.
      class  WordsPerLineAverage
      A feature extractor that extracts the average number of words per line.
      class  WordsPerLineVariance
      A feature extractor that extracts the variance of the number of words per line.
      class  WordVariety
      A feature extractor that extracts the total number of words in a text divided by the number of unique words in the text.
